image.altText: Meg O'Neill and Richard Goyder sitting and speaking to the media

props.synopsis: Woodside is being forced to defend its climate transition plan, with the gas giant's shareholders rejecting it.

title.children: 'Ignoring the science': Woodside shareholder revolt sees climate plan rejected

image.altText: A photo of a woman sitting in a brightly lit restaurant

props.synopsis: A Perth man is on trial for murder after he allegedly used a claw hammer to kill his lover, a nurse who was eight months pregnant with his baby.

title.children: Heavily pregnant nurse killed by lover with claw hammer after she refused to abort his baby, court told

image.altText: A Collier Homes sign outside a building construction site.

props.synopsis: One of Perth's best-known residential building companies, Collier Homes, has been placed into administration, with one lobby group expecting more will follow suit.

title.children: More construction companies tipped to go under following downfall of well-known WA builder

image.altText: An aerial view of an open pit gold mine on a salt lake.

props.synopsis: The Department of Energy, Mines, Industry Regulation and Safety has confirmed the fatal incident occurred yesterday and investigators are at the scene.

title.children: Investigation underway after 21-year-old man dies at WA mine site

image.altText: A young boy in a hoodie walks out of a police paddy wagon with a female police officer standing nearby.

props.synopsis: Police say seven young people arrested as part of counterterrorism investigation into Wakeley stabbing attack share aÂ  "religiously motivated violent extremist ideology".

title.children: 'No immediate danger': Children arrested by counterterrorism police in raids across Sydney

image.altText: Two  women walk past the Reserve Bank of Australia headquarters, with the building's name prominent in the background.

props.synopsis: Inflation has come in higher than expected during the March quarter, with prices rising by 1 per cent and annual inflation slowing to 3.6 per cent â reducing the possibility of the Reserve Bank cutting interest rates later this year.Â

title.children: 'Can't write off the possibility' of a rate hike, economist warns, as inflation comes in higher than expected

image.altText: Players, umpires and fans, stand during an Anzac Observance before a night AFL match

props.synopsis: Richmond take on Melbourne at the MCG on Anzac Day Eve in a meeting of recent premiers at different ends of the ladder. Follow the ceremonies and all the action in our live blog.Â Â

title.children: Tigers and Dees begin Anzac Round in front of anticipated massive MCG crowd

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: The Eternal Flame is lit at the MCG

props.synopsis: The eSafety commissioner and social media platform X are back in Federal Court to debate the status of posts featuring footage of the Wakeley church attack.Â

title.children: Bishop Emmanuel wants footage of his stabbing in church to stay online, court hears

image.altText: West Coast Eagles defender Tom Barrass on the turf

props.synopsis: The West Coast defender attempted to use the same tribunal tactic Charlie Cameron used a week ago, but this time there were not enough "exceptional and compelling circumstances".Â

title.children: 'The facts here are different': Barrass unable to overturn ban on 'good guy' defence

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann speaks to 7NEWS Spotlight in an interview.

props.synopsis: Australian Federal Police commissioner Reece Kershaw told the National Press Club today police were reviewing the matter to see whether an investigation was needed into how an image of Brittany Higgins's text messages came to be in the possession of the Seven Network.

title.children: Police reviewing how image of Brittany Higgins's texts was obtained by Seven ahead of Bruce Lehrmann interview

image.altText: Aerial view of an airbase with a runway surrounded by trees.

props.synopsis: Locals are alarmed that Chinese men dropped on a remote beach were able to enter an Australian air base undetected, given the ramping up of surveillance along the crocodile-infested coastline.

title.children: Despite increased surveillance, Chinese men walked onto a northern Australian airstrip

image.altText: Composite image of Brittany Higgins and Defence Minister Linda Reynolds

props.synopsis: Senator Linda Reynolds sues her former political staffer Brittany Higgins and Ms Higgins's partner David Sharaz for defamation over a series of social media posts â and neither side appears willing to back down.Â

title.children: While all eyes have been on the failed Bruce Lehrmann defamation case, another legal drama is playing out in WA

image.altText: A police car flashes its lights in front of police tape. Behind is a car on its head with smashed windows.

props.synopsis: NT Police have now arrested everyone who allegedly fled the scene of a car crash last month in Alice Springs. The fallout from the incident has been linked to the social unrest that led to the recent youth curfew in the town.

title.children: Police arrest eight people who allegedly fled fatal car crash in Alice Springs

image.altText: An Australian Border Force officer, with badge in foreground, holds a passport in background.

props.synopsis: ABF Commissioner Michael Outram has apologised to female staff in the marine unit, after a workplace review found sexual harassment and discrimination are so widespread, that "immediate intervention" is needed.

title.children: ABF commissioner apologises after sexual harassment and discrimination found within Border Force's marine unit

image.altText: A phone displaying the meta logo sits on a computer keyboard

props.synopsis: The launch of Meta's artificial intelligence tool has generated a wave of confusion among usersÂ as the AI bots descended upon familiar social media apps and began interacting with real people. Here are five quick questions on what the new tool means for users.

title.children: Meta AI has rolled out on our social media apps to a mixed reception. Here's why and what to do with it

image.altText: A man in a patterned shirt stands against a graffitied wall.

props.synopsis: It's Pay Day! Professor Jioji Ravulo explains how sharing his money with his extended family was part of life from his very first pay cheque and why, even now, he's always on the hunt for a good bargain.

title.children: Growing up in public housing taughtÂ Jioji Ravulo the art of budgeting. His number one tip: Always buy the specials

image.altText: Vapour pours from a mill chimney behind power poles.

props.synopsis: As Australia works towards net zero by 2050, the latest data shows WA, a state reliant on the resources sector for its economic prosperity, continues to struggle mightily in its efforts to decarbonise.

title.children: 'Holding back progress Australia-wide': WA's greenhouse gas emissions surge again

image.altText: A woman stands behind a bar.

props.synopsis: A popular and historic pub in WA's Goldfields faces closure over safety concerns, while the tenants say they are being unfairly forced out.Â

title.children: A 'dilapidated' outback pub faces closure, but the tenants are fighting back

image.altText: Melbourne Demons player Harley Balic stands in the rain at AFL training.

props.synopsis: The death of 25-year-old Fremantle player Harley Balic will reportedly be looked at as part of a probe into the AFL's illicit drugs policy, with former coach Ross Lyon speaking emotionally about Balic as "a pretty special young man".

title.children: Death of former AFL player Harley Balic reportedly to be looked at in drug probe

image.altText: NRL player Terry Hill running with the ball under his arm, looking ahead at the defence.

props.synopsis: Terry Hill, one of the best centres in Australian rugby league in the 1990s, has died aged 52.

title.children: Former Kangaroo and NSW Origin player Terry Hill dies

image.altText: Donald Trump sits in court next to his lawyer Todd Blanche

props.synopsis: A former newspaper publisher outlines how he bought and buried negative stories about Donald Trump, and the former president's lawyer is chastised by a judge, as the "hush money" criminal trial continues in New York.

title.children: 'You're losing all credibility,' judge tells Trump's lawyer, and other key moments from the 'hush money' trial

image.altText: A profile image of a woman with long, ice blonde hair. She has a slight smile on her face.

props.synopsis: Premier Chris Minns says he has requested that Attorney-General Michael Daley review the circumstances leading up to the alleged murder of 28-year-old Molly Ticehurst this week.Â

title.children: NSW premier flags potential AV links for serious bail hearings after alleged murder of central west woman

image.altText: A sign saying Welcome to Halls Creek

props.synopsis: Halls Creek Shire has apologised for its handling of a work vehicle crash which occurred on a public holiday near a popular recreation spot, as ratepayers lament a potential waste of vital funds.

title.children: Residents fume over cash-strapped outback shire's botched insurance claim on $100,000 vehicle

image.altText: A crocodile's head at the surface of a river.

props.synopsis: Less than a year since a 67-year-old tourist was bitten at a popular Top End swimming spot, the NT government has upped its annual quota for saltwater croc harvest by 900.

title.children: 'Every 50 to 100 metres': Why an explosion in crocodile numbers is leading to a mass removal

image.altText: Dr Amireh at her desk seeing a patient.

props.synopsis: Law firms involved in the case said it was the largest underpayment class action outcome in Australian legal history.

title.children: 'I did this for a cultural change': Doctor's underpayment fight leads to $230m settlement

image.altText: Hannah sitting in the sun smiling with a drink in hand.

props.synopsis: Childcare worker and mother Molly Ticehurst was found dead in a regional New South Wales home on Monday morning. The Forbes local was 28 years old. And, sheÂ was the 25th woman to die from gender-based violence in Australia this year.Â

title.children: Samantha Murphy was 13th, Hannah McGuire the 18th: The violent deaths of women this year is a 'crisis'

image.altText: Call for app to help children in state care

props.synopsis: The federal opposition urges the government to trial age verification schemes that would lock children out of social media platforms, as X's feud with Australia escalates.

title.children: Government considers online age laws that could restrict children from social media

image.altText: Hand holding money, notes and coins with a coffee cup and fruit in the background, cost of living

props.synopsis: Australian inflation keeps falling, but not as fast as economists, including those at the Reserve Bank, had hoped. That has slashed rate cut bets and wiped out early gains on the ASX. Look back on the day's events and insights from our business reporters as it happened with our blog.

title.children: ASX flat as rate cut bets for 2024 are all but gone â as it happened

image.altText: A young brunette smiling in a black graduation cap and gown at a university, with other graduates and families in the background

props.synopsis: The release of March inflation data means student HECS-HELP debts are set to rise by 4.7 per cent on the first of June.

title.children: Is HECS-HELP debt still 'good debt'? And is it worth paying off early?

image.altText: University students sitting on chairs at their graduation with a blue cap and gown on

props.synopsis: Now we have the latest inflation data, we can work out how much HECS debts will be indexed by â but that's only if the Australian Tax Office uses the same formula as last year.Â

title.children: HECS indexation is expected to be 4.7 per cent. Check how much extra you could be paying with our calculator

image.altText: woman smiles at camera standing inkitchen with stairs leading up to her left

props.synopsis: Coby Koster found her way out of the rental market by purchasing a tiny home but says planning hiccups among local governments are holding other people back.

title.children: Councils explore cutting red tape for tiny homes with big planning requirements

image.altText: Arj Barker speaks into a microphone while standing on stage in front of purple backdrop

props.synopsis: It really should come as no surprise to Arj Barker that the eviction of a breastfeeding mother from his Melbourne show has whipped up another round of culture wars, butÂ these situations are complicated by differing experiences and emotional triggers â and culture wars aren't good with detail.

title.children: Australia's culture wars are back on the topic of breasts. It's no great surprise, but perhaps this time there's a lesson

image.altText: Former teacher Gaye Grant leaves the NSW Court of Criminal Appeal in Sydney with face mask and black hat

props.synopsis: Gaye Grant has been sentenced to at least three years and four months in prison after she admitted to having a sexual relationship with a boy between 1977 and 1979.

title.children: Paedophile female teacher fights to have conviction quashed after court rules law did not apply to women

image.altText: A woman in a blue cardigan and purple skirt sits at a bus stop

props.synopsis: Baby Reindeer is currently the most watched TV title on Netflix but some fans are taking the real life story of a stalker and the man she stalked too far.

title.children: Baby Reindeer is a nuanced look at trauma; itâs also inspiring fans to dox women

image.altText: The main characters in The Idea of You about to kiss, headshot, embrace

props.synopsis: While promoting her new film The Idea of You, actor Anne Hathaway described as 'gross' previous practices she's been subjected to involving chemistry auditions where she had to kiss a long list of potential co-stars, one after the other.

title.children: Oscar-winner Anne Hathaway kissed '10 guys' in chemistry audition in a practice she describes as 'gross'
